summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 CHEVROLET TRAILBLAZER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE ATTEMPTING TO OPEN THE FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE WINDOW, THE CONTROL MODULE FAILED TO RESPOND. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS CONFIRMED THAT THE POWER WINDOW SWITCH FAILED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED TO SCHEDULE REPAIRS BUT THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE PARTS WERE NOT AVAILABLE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE CONTACT ALSO STATED THAT THREE MONTHS WAS AN EXTREMELY LONG TIME TO WAIT FOR A RECALL REMEDY REPAIR. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 69,000.  UPDATED 01/15/13*LJ    THE CONSUMER STATED IT IS NOW JANUARY AND REPAIRS HAD NOT BEEN MADE TO THE VEHICLE. UPDATED 1/24/2013*JS
